author: Jack Davis
title: Trump: America ‘Seriously Divided Before I Got Here’
text:
Rex Tillerson Cleaning House At The State Department 
Trump returned to that theme as his press conference came to a close. "This isn't Donald Trump that divided a nation…We lived in a divided nation."– @POTUS talked about the split among Americans. pic.twitter.com/hFQRXM9P0O 
— Fox News (@FoxNews) February 16, 2017 
”… this isn’t Donald Trump that divided a nation. We went eight years with President Obama and we went many years before President Obama. We lived in a divided nation. And I am going to try — I will do everything within my power to fix that.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Trump addressed America’s divisions as he discussed the plight of its devastated urban core. 
“It’s taken more a hundred years and more for some of these places to evolve and they evolved, many of them, very badly,” he said. “You go to some of these inner city places and it’s so sad when you look at the crime. You have people — and I’ve seen this, and I’ve sort of witnessed it — in fact, in two cases I have actually witnessed it. They lock themselves into apartments, petrified to even leave, in the middle of the day.” 
“They’re living in hell. We can’t let that happen. So, we’re going to be very, very strong,” Trump said, noting that improvements in education and healthcare would be among his remedies for urban ills. 
“It’s been festering for many, many years. But we have places in this country that we have to fix,” he said. Advertisement - story continues below
